Raag Soohee − Part 001 728 : 1 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 728 : 2 Raag Soohee, First Mehl, Chau−Padas, First House: 728 : 3 Wash the vessel, sit down and anoint it with fragrance; then, go out and get the milk. 728 : 4 Add the rennet of clear consciousness to the milk of good deeds, and then, free of desire, let it curdle. ||1|| 728 : 5 Chant the Name of the One Lord. 728 : 6 All other actions are fruitless. ||1||Pause|| 728 : 7 Let your mind be the handles, and then churn it, without sleeping. 728 : 8 If you chant the Naam, the Name of the Lord ,with your tongue, then the curd will be churned. In this way, the Ambrosial Nectar is obtained. ||2|| 728 : 9 2

Wash your mind in the pool of Truth, and let it be the vessel of the Lord; let this be your offering to please Him. 728 : 10 That humble servant who dedicates and offers his life, and who serves in this way, remains absorbed in his Lord and Master. ||3|| 728 : 11 The speakers speak and speak and speak, and then they depart. There is no other to compare to You. 728 : 12 Servant Nanak, lacking devotion, humbly prays: may I sing the Praises of the True Lord. ||4||1|| 728 : 13 Soohee, First Mehl, Second House: 728 : 14 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 728 : 15 Deep within the self, the Lord abides; do not go outside looking for Him. 728 : 16 You have renounced the Ambrosial Nectar − why are you eating poison? ||1|| 728 : 17 Meditate on such spiritual wisdom, O my mind, 728 : 18 Raag Soohee − Part 001 3

and become the slave of the True Lord. ||1||Pause|| 728 : 19 Everyone speaks of wisdom and meditation; 728 : 20 but bound in bondage, the whole world is wandering around in confusion. ||2|| 728 : 21 One who serves the Lord is His servant. 728 : 22 The Lord is pervading and permeating the water, the land, and the sky. ||3|| 728 : 23 I am not good; no one is bad. 728 : 24 Prays Nanak, He alone saves us! ||4||1||2|| −− Raag Soohee − Part 001 −− Raag Soohee − Part 001 4

Raag Soohee − Part 002 729 : 25 Soohee, First Mehl, Sixth House: 729 : 26 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 729 : 27 Bronze is bright and shiny, but when it is rubbed, its blackness appears. 729 : 28 Washing it, its impurity is not removed, even if it is washed a hundred times. ||1|| 729 : 29 They alone are my friends, who travel along with me; 729 : 30 and in that place, where the accounts are called for, they appear standing with me. ||1||Pause|| 729 : 31 There are houses, mansions and tall buildings, painted on all sides; 729 : 32 but they are empty within, and they crumble like useless ruins. ||2|| 729 : 33 The herons in their white feathers dwell in the sacred shrines of pilgrimage. 5

729 : 34 They tear apart and eat the living beings, and so they are not called white. ||3|| 729 : 35 My body is like the simmal tree; seeing me, other people are fooled. 729 : 36 Its fruits are useless − just like the qualities of my body. ||4|| 729 : 37 The blind man is carrying such a heavy load, and his journey through the mountains is so long. 729 : 38 My eyes can see, but I cannot find the Way. How can I climb up and cross over the mountain? ||5|| 729 : 39 What good does it do to serve, and be good, and be clever? 729 : 40 O Nanak, contemplate the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and you shall be released from bondage. ||6||1||3|| 729 : 41 Soohee, First Mehl: 729 : 42 Build the raft of meditation and self−discipline, to carry you across the river. 729 : 43 Raag Soohee − Part 002 6

There will be no ocean, and no rising tides to stop you; this is how comfortable your path shall be. ||1|| 729 : 44 Your Name alone is the color, in which the robe of my body is dyed. This color is permanent, O my Beloved. ||1||Pause|| 729 : 45 My beloved friends have departed; how will they meet the Lord? 729 : 46 If they have virtue in their pack, the Lord will unite them with Himself. ||2|| 729 : 47 Once united with Him, they will not be separated again, if they are truly united. 729 : 48 The True Lord brings their comings and goings to an end. ||3|| 729 : 49 One who subdues and eradicates egotism, sews the robe of devotion. 729 : 50 Following the Word of the Guru's Teachings, she receives the fruits of her reward, the Ambrosial Words of the Lord. ||4|| 729 : 51 Says Nanak, O soul−brides, our Husband Lord is so dear! 729 : 52 Raag Soohee − Part 002 7

We are the servants, the hand−maidens of the Lord; He is our True Lord and Master. ||5||2||4|| 729 : 53 Soohee, First Mehl: 729 : 54 Those whose minds are filled with love of the Lord, are blessed and exalted. 729 : 55 They are blessed with peace, and their pains are forgotten. 729 : 56 He will undoubtedly, certainly save them. ||1|| 729 : 57 The Guru comes to meet those whose destiny is so pre−ordained. 729 : 58 He blesses them with the Teachings of the Ambrosial Name of the Lord. 729 : 59 Those who walk in the Will of the True Guru, never wander begging. ||2|| 729 : 60 And one who lives in the Mansion of the Lord's Presence, why should he bow down to any other? 729 : 61 The gate−keeper at the Lord's Gate shall not stop him to ask any questions. Raag Soohee − Part 002 8

729 : 62 And one who is blessed with the Lord's Glance of Grace − by his words, others are emancipated as well. ||3|| 729 : 63 The Lord Himself sends out, and recalls the mortal beings; no one else gives Him advice. 729 : 64 He Himself demolishes, constructs and creates; He knows everything. 729 : 65 O Nanak, the Naam, the Name of the Lord is the blessing, given to those who receive His Mercy, and His Grace. ||4||3||5|| −− Raag Soohee − Part 002 −− Raag Soohee − Part 002 9

Raag Soohee − Part 003 730 : 66 Soohee, First Mehl: 730 : 67 That vessel alone is pure, which is pleasing to Him. 730 : 68 The filthiest vessel does not become pure, simply by being washed. 730 : 69 Through the Gurdwara, the Guru's Gate, one obtains understanding. 730 : 70 By being washed through this Gate, it becomes pure. 730 : 71 The Lord Himself sets the standards to differentiate between the dirty and the pure. 730 : 72 Do not think that you will automatically find a place of rest hereafter. 730 : 73 According to the actions one has committed, so does the mortal become. 730 : 74 He Himself bestows the Ambrosial Name of the Lord. 10

730 : 75 Such a mortal departs with honor and renown; his life is embellished and redeemed, and the trumpets resound with his glory. 730 : 76 Why speak of poor mortals? His glory shall echo throughout the three worlds. 730 : 77 O Nanak, he himself shall be enraptured, and he shall save his entire ancestry. ||1||4||6|| 730 : 78 Soohee, First Mehl: 730 : 79 The Yogi practices yoga, and the pleasure−seeker practices eating. 730 : 80 The austere practice austerities, bathing and rubbing themselves at sacred shrines of pilgrimage. ||1|| 730 : 81 Let me hear some news of You, O Beloved; if only someone would come and sit with me, and tell me. ||1||Pause|| 730 : 82 As one plants, so does he harvest; whatever he earns, he eats. 730 : 83 In the world hereafter, his account is not called for, if he goes with the insignia of the Lord. ||2|| Raag Soohee − Part 003 11

730 : 84 According to the actions the mortal commits, so is he proclaimed. 730 : 85 And that breath which is drawn without thinking of the Lord, that breath goes in vain. ||3|| 730 : 86 I would sell this body, if someone would only purchase it. 730 : 87 O Nanak, that body is of no use at all, if it does not enshrine the Name of the True Lord. ||4||5||7|| 730 : 88 Soohee, First Mehl, Seventh House: 730 : 89 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 730 : 90 Yoga is not the patched coat, Yoga is not the walking stick. Yoga is not smearing the body with ashes. 730 : 91 Yoga is not the ear−rings, and not the shaven head. Yoga is not the blowing of the horn. 730 : 92 Remaining unblemished in the midst of the filth of the world − this is the way to attain Yoga. ||1|| 730 : 93 Raag Soohee − Part 003 12

By mere words, Yoga is not attained. 730 : 94 One who looks upon all with a single eye, and knows them to be one and the same − he alone is known as a Yogi. ||1||Pause|| 730 : 95 Yoga is not wandering to the tombs of the dead; Yoga is not sitting in trances. 730 : 96 Yoga is not wandering through foreign lands; Yoga is not bathing at sacred shrines of pilgrimage. 730 : 97 Remaining unblemished in the midst of the filth of the world − this is the way to attain Yoga. ||2|| 730 : 98 Meeting with the True Guru, doubt is dispelled, and the wandering mind is restrained. 730 : 99 Nectar rains down, celestial music resounds, and deep within, wisdom is obtained. 730 : 100 Remaining unblemished in the midst of the filth of the world − this is the way to attain Yoga. ||3|| 730 : 101 O Nanak, remain dead while yet alive − practice such a Yoga. 730 : 102 Raag Soohee − Part 003 13

When the horn is blown without being blown, then you shall attain the state of fearless dignity. 730 : 103 Remaining unblemished in the midst of the filth of the world − this is the way to attain Yoga. ||4||1||8|| 730 : 104 Soohee, First Mehl: 730 : 105 What scale, what weights, and what assayer shall I call for You, Lord? 730 : 106 From what guru should I receive instruction? By whom should I have Your value appraised? ||1|| −− Raag Soohee − Part 003 −− Raag Soohee − Part 003 14

Raag Soohee − Part 004 731 : 107 O my Dear Beloved Lord, Your limits are not known. 731 : 108 You pervade the water, the land, and the sky; You Yourself are All−pervading. ||1||Pause|| 731 : 109 Mind is the scale, consciousness the weights, and the performance of Your service is the appraiser. 731 : 110 Deep within my heart, I weigh my Husband Lord; in this way I focus my consciousness. ||2|| 731 : 111 You Yourself are the balance, the weights and the scale; You Yourself are the weigher. 731 : 112 You Yourself see, and You Yourself understand; You Yourself are the trader. ||3|| 731 : 113 The blind, low class wandering soul, comes for a moment, and departs in an instant. 731 : 114 In its company, Nanak dwells; how can the fool attain the Lord? ||4||2||9|| 731 : 115 Raag Soohee, Fourth Mehl, First House: 15

731 : 116 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 731 : 117 My mind worships and adores the Lord's Name, through the Guru, and the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 731 : 118 All the desires of my mind and body have been fulfilled; all fear of death has been dispelled. ||1|| 731 : 119 O my mind, sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord's Name. 731 : 120 And when the Guru is pleased and satisfied, the mind is instructed; it then joyfully drinks in the subtle essence of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 731 : 121 The Sat Sangat, the True Congregation of the True Guru, is sublime and exalted. They sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord God. 731 : 122 Bless me with Your Mercy, Lord, and unite me with the Sat Sangat; I wash the feet of Your humble servants. ||2|| 731 : 123 The Lord's Name is all. The Lord's Name is the essence of the Guru's Teachings, the juice, the sweetness of it. 731 : 124 Raag Soohee − Part 004 16

I have found the Ambrosial Nectar, the Divine Water of the Lord's Name, and all my thirst for it is quenched. ||3|| 731 : 125 The Guru, the True Guru, is my social status and honor; I have sold my head to the Guru. 731 : 126 Servant Nanak is called the chaylaa, the disciple of the Guru; O Guru, save the honor of Your servant. ||4||1|| 731 : 127 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 731 : 128 I chant and vibrate the Name of the Lord God, the Supreme Being, Har, Har; my poverty and problems have all been eradicated. 731 : 129 The fear of birth and death has been erased, through the Word of the Guru's Shabad; serving the Unmoving, Unchanging Lord, I am absorbed in peace. ||1|| 731 : 130 O my mind, vibrate the Name of the most Beloved, Darling Lord. 731 : 131 I have dedicated my mind and body, and placed them in offering before the Guru; I have sold my head to the Guru, for a very dear price. ||1||Pause|| 731 : 132 The kings and the rulers of men enjoy pleasures and delights, but without the Name of the Lord, death seizes and dispatches them all. Raag Soohee − Part 004 17

731 : 133 The Righteous Judge of Dharma strikes them over the heads with his staff, and when the fruits of their actions come into their hands, then they regret and repent. ||2|| 731 : 134 Save me, save me, Lord; I am Your humble servant, a mere worm. I seek the Protection of Your Sanctuary, O Primal Lord, Cherisher and Nourisher. 731 : 135 Please bless me with the Blessed Vision of the Saint's Darshan, that I may find peace. O God, please fulfill the desires of Your humble servant. ||3|| 731 : 136 You are the All−powerful, Great, Primal God, my Lord and Master. O Lord, please bless me with the gift of humility. 731 : 137 Servant Nanak has found the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and is at peace; I am forever a sacrifice to the Naam. ||4||2|| 731 : 138 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 731 : 139 The Lord's Name is the Love of the Lord. The Lord's Love is the permanent color. 731 : 140 When the Guru is totally satisfied and pleased, He colors us with the Lord's Love; this color shall never fade away. ||1|| −− Raag Soohee − Part 004 −− Raag Soohee − Part 004 18

Raag Soohee − Part 005 732 : 141 O my mind, enshrine love for the Name of the Lord. 732 : 142 The Guru, satisfied and pleased, taught me about the Lord, and my Sovereign Lord King met with me at once. ||1||Pause|| 732 : 143 The self−willed manmukh is like the ignorant bride, who comes and goes again and again in reincarnation. 732 : 144 The Lord God does not come into her consciousness, and her mind is stuck in the love of duality. ||2|| 732 : 145 I am full of filth, and I practice evil deeds; O Lord, save me, be with me, merge me into Your Being! 732 : 146 The Guru has bathed me in the pool of Ambrosial Nectar, and all my dirty sins and mistakes have been washed away. ||3|| 732 : 147 O Lord God, Merciful to the meek and the poor, please unite me with the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation. 732 : 148 Joining the Sangat, servant Nanak has obtained the Lord's Love; my mind and body are drenched in it. ||4||3|| 19

732 : 149 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 732 : 150 One who chants the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, while constantly practicing deception, shall never become pure of heart. 732 : 151 He may perform all sorts of rituals, night and day, but he shall not find peace, even in dreams. ||1|| 732 : 152 O wise ones, without the Guru, there is no devotional worship. 732 : 153 The untreated cloth does not take up the dye, no matter how much everyone may wish it. ||1||Pause|| 732 : 154 The self−willed manmukh may perform chants, meditations, austere self−discipline, fasts and devotional worship, but his sickness does not go away. 732 : 155 Deep within him is the sickness of excessive egotism; in the love of duality he is ruined. ||2|| 732 : 156 Outwardly, he wears religious robes and he is very clever, but his mind wanders in the ten directions. 732 : 157 Engrossed in ego, he does not remember the Word of the Shabad; over and over again, he is reincarnated. ||3|| Raag Soohee − Part 005 20

732 : 158 O Nanak, that mortal who is blessed with the Lord's Glance of Grace, understands Him; that humble servant meditates on the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 732 : 159 By Guru's Grace, he understands the One Lord, and is absorbed into the One Lord. ||4||4|| 732 : 160 Soohee, Fourth Mehl, Second House: 732 : 161 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 732 : 162 Following the Guru's Teachings, I searched and searched the body−village; 732 : 163 I found the wealth of the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. ||1|| 732 : 164 The Lord, Har, Har, has enshrined peace within my mind. 732 : 165 The fire of desire was extinguished in an instant, when I met the Guru; all my hunger has been satisfied. ||1||Pause|| 732 : 166 Singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, I live, O my mother. 732 : 167 Raag Soohee − Part 005 21

The Merciful True Guru implanted the Glorious Praises of the Naam within me. ||2|| 732 : 168 I search for and seek out my Beloved Lord God, Har, Har. 732 : 169 Joining the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, I have obtained the subtle essence of the Lord. ||3|| 732 : 170 By the pre−ordained destiny inscribed upon my forehead, I have found the Lord. 732 : 171 Guru Nanak, pleased and satisfied, has united me with the Lord, O Siblings of Destiny. ||4||1||5|| 732 : 172 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 732 : 173 Showering His Mercy, the Lord imbues the mind with His Love. 732 : 174 The Gurmukh merges in the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. ||1|| 732 : 175 Imbued with the Lord's Love, the mortal enjoys the pleasure of His Love. 732 : 176 He remains always blissful, day and night, and he merges into the Shabad, the Word of the Perfect Guru. ||1||Pause|| Raag Soohee − Part 005 22

732 : 177 Everyone longs for the Lord's Love; 732 : 178 the Gurmukh is imbued with the deep red color of His Love. ||2|| 732 : 179 The foolish, self−willed manmukh is left pale and uncolored. −− Raag Soohee − Part 005 −− Raag Soohee − Part 005 23

Raag Soohee − Part 006 733 : 180 Even if he wishes it a hundred times, he does not obtain the Lord's Love. ||3|| 733 : 181 But if the Lord blesses him with His Glance of Grace, then he meets the True Guru. 733 : 182 Nanak is absorbed into the subtle essence of the Lord's Love. ||4||2||6|| 733 : 183 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 733 : 184 My tongue remains satisfied with the subtle essence of the Lord. 733 : 185 The Gurmukh drinks it in, and merges in celestial peace. ||1|| 733 : 186 If you taste the subtle essence of the Lord, O humble Siblings of Destiny, 733 : 187 then how can you be enticed by other flavors? ||1||Pause|| 733 : 188 Under Guru's Instructions, keep this subtle essence enshrined in your heart. 24

733 : 189 Those who are imbued with the subtle essence of the Lord, are immersed in celestial bliss. ||2|| 733 : 190 The self−willed manmukh cannot even taste the subtle essence of the Lord. 733 : 191 He acts out in ego, and suffers terrible punishment. ||3|| 733 : 192 But if he is blessed with the Lord's Kind Mercy, then he obtains the subtle essence of the Lord. 733 : 193 O Nanak, absorbed in this subtle essence of the Lord, sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||4||3||7|| 733 : 194 Soohee, Fourth Mehl, Sixth House: 733 : 195 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 733 : 196 When someone of low social class chants the Lord's Name, he obtains the state of highest dignity. 733 : 197 Go and ask Bidar, the son of a maid; Krishna himself stayed in his house. ||1|| Raag Soohee − Part 006 25

733 : 198 Listen, O humble Siblings of Destiny, to the Unspoken Speech of the Lord; it removes all anxiety, pain and hunger. ||1||Pause|| 733 : 199 Ravi Daas, the leather−worker, praised the Lord, and sang the Kirtan of His Praises each and every instant. 733 : 200 Although he was of low social status, he was exalted and elevated, and people of all four castes came and bowed at his feet. ||2|| 733 : 201 Naam Dayv loved the Lord; the people called him a fabric dyer. 733 : 202 The Lord turned His back on the high−class Kh'shaatriyas and Brahmins, and showed His face to Naam Dayv. ||3|| 733 : 203 All of the devotees and servants of the Lord have the tilak, the ceremonial mark, applied to their foreheads at the sixty−eight sacred shrines of pilgrimage. 733 : 204 Servant Nanak shall touch their feet night and day, if the Lord, the King, grants His Grace. ||4||1||8|| 733 : 205 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 733 : 206 Raag Soohee − Part 006 26

They alone worship and adore the Lord deep within, who are blessed with such pre−ordained destiny from the very beginning of time. 733 : 207 What can anyone do to undermine them? My Creator Lord is on their side. ||1|| 733 : 208 So meditate on the Lord, Har, Har, O my mind. Meditate on the Lord, O mind; He is the Eliminator of all the pains of reincarnation. ||1||Pause|| 733 : 209 In the very beginning, the Lord blessed His devotees with the Ambrosial Nectar, the treasure of devotion. 733 : 210 Anyone who tries to compete with them is a fool; his face shall be blackened here and hereafter. ||2|| 733 : 211 They alone are devotees, and they alone are selfless servants, who love the Lord's Name. 733 : 212 By their selfless service, they find the Lord, while ashes fall on the heads of the slanderers. ||3|| 733 : 213 He alone knows this, who experiences it within the home of his own self. Ask Guru Nanak, the Guru of the world, and reflect upon it. 733 : 214 Throughout the four generations of the Gurus, from the beginning of time and throughout the ages, no one has ever found the Lord by back−biting and undermining. Only by serving the Lord with love, is one emancipated. ||4||2||9|| Raag Soohee − Part 006 27
733 : 215 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 733 : 216 Wherever the Lord is worshipped in adoration, there the Lord becomes one's friend and helper. −− Raag Soohee − Part 006 −− Raag Soohee − Part 006 28

Raag Soohee − Part 007 734 : 217 By Guru's Grace, the Lord comes to dwell in the mind; He cannot be obtained in any other way. ||1|| 734 : 218 So gather in the wealth of the Lord, O Siblings of Destiny, 734 : 219 so that in this world and the next, the Lord shall be your friend and companion. ||1||Pause|| 734 : 220 In the company of the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, you shall earn the wealth of the Lord; this wealth of the Lord is not obtained anywhere else, by any other means, at all. 734 : 221 The dealer in the Lord's Jewels purchases the wealth of the Lord's jewels; the dealer in cheap glass jewels cannot acquire the Lord's wealth by empty words. ||2|| 734 : 222 The Lord's wealth is like jewels, gems and rubies. At the appointed time in the Amrit Vaylaa, the ambrosial hours of the morning, the Lord's devotees lovingly center their attention on the Lord, and the wealth of the Lord. 734 : 223 The devotees of the Lord plant the seed of the Lord's wealth in the ambrosial hours of the Amrit Vaylaa; they eat it, and spend it, but it is never exhausted. 734 : 224 In this world and the next, the devotees are blessed with glorious greatness, the wealth of the Lord. ||3|| 29

734 : 225 The wealth of the Fearless Lord is permanent, forever and ever, and true. This wealth of the Lord cannot be destroyed by fire or water; neither thieves nor the Messenger of Death can take it away. 734 : 226 Thieves cannot even approach the Lord's wealth; Death, the tax collector cannot tax it. ||4|| 734 : 227 The faithless cynics commit sins and gather in their poisonous wealth, but it shall not go along with them for even a single step. 734 : 228 In this world, the faithless cynics become miserable, as it slips away through their hands. In the world hereafter, the faithless cynics find no shelter in the Court of the Lord. ||5|| 734 : 229 The Lord Himself is the Banker of this wealth, O Saints; when the Lord gives it, the mortal loads it and takes it away. 734 : 230 This wealth of the Lord is never exhausted; the Guru has given this understanding to servant Nanak. ||6||3||10|| 734 : 231 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 734 : 232 That mortal, with whom the Lord is pleased, repeats the Glorious Praises of the Lord; he alone is a devotee, and he alone is approved. 734 : 233 Raag Soohee − Part 007 30

How can his glory be described? Within his heart, the Primal Lord, the Lord God, abides. ||1|| 734 : 234 Sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the Universe; focus your meditation on the True Guru. ||1||Pause|| 734 : 235 He is the True Guru − service to the True Guru is fruitful and rewarding. By this service, the greatest treasure is obtained. 734 : 236 The faithless cynics in their love of duality and sensual desires, harbor foul−smelling urges. They are totally useless and ignorant. ||2|| 734 : 237 One who has faith − his singing is approved. He is honored in the Court of the Lord. 734 : 238 Those who lack faith may close their eyes, hypocritically pretending and faking devotion, but their false pretenses shall soon wear off. ||3|| 734 : 239 My soul and body are totally Yours, Lord; You are the Inner−knower, the Searcher of hearts, my Primal Lord God. 734 : 240 So speaks servant Nanak, the slave of Your slaves; as You make me speak, so do I speak. ||4||4||11|| −− Raag Soohee − Part 007 −− Raag Soohee − Part 007 31

Raag Soohee − Part 008 735 : 241 Soohee, Fourth Mehl, Seventh House: 735 : 242 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 735 : 243 Which, which of Your Glorious Virtues should I sing and recount, Lord? You are my Lord and Master, the treasure of excellence. 735 : 244 I cannot express Your Glorious Praises. You are my Lord and Master, lofty and benevolent. ||1|| 735 : 245 The Name of the Lord, Har, Har, is my only support. 735 : 246 If it pleases You, please save me, O my Lord and Master; without You, I have no other at all. ||1||Pause|| 735 : 247 You alone are my strength, and my Court, O my Lord and Master; unto You alone I pray. 735 : 248 There is no other place where I can offer my prayers; I can tell my pains and pleasures only to You. ||2|| 735 : 249 32

Water is locked up in the earth, and fire is locked up in wood. 735 : 250 The sheep and the lions are kept in one place; O mortal, meditate on the Lord, and your doubts and fears shall be removed. ||3|| 735 : 251 So behold the glorious greatness of the Lord, O Saints; the Lord blesses the dishonored with honor. 735 : 252 As dust rises from underfoot, O Nanak, so does the Lord make all people fall at the feet of the Holy. ||4||1||12|| 735 : 253 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 735 : 254 You Yourself, O Creator, know everything; what can I possibly tell You? 735 : 255 You know all the bad and the good; as we act, so are we rewarded. ||1|| 735 : 256 O my Lord and Master, You alone know the state of my inner being. 735 : 257 You know all the bad and the good; as it pleases You, so You make us speak. ||1||Pause|| 735 : 258 Raag Soohee − Part 008 33

The Lord has infused the love of Maya into all bodies; through this human body, there comes the opportunity to worship the Lord with devotion. 735 : 259 You unite some with the True Guru, and bless them with peace; while others, the self−willed manmukhs, are engrossed in worldly affairs. ||2|| 735 : 260 All belong to You, and You belong to all, O my Creator Lord; You wrote the words of destiny on the forehead of everyone. 735 : 261 As You bestow Your Glance of Grace, so are mortals made; without Your Gracious Glance, no one assumes any form. ||3|| 735 : 262 You alone know Your Glorious Greatness; everyone constantly meditates on You. 735 : 263 That being, with whom You are pleased, is united with You; O servant Nanak, only such a mortal is accepted. ||4||2||13|| 735 : 264 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 735 : 265 Those beings, within whose inner selves my Lord, Har, Har, dwells − all their diseases are cured. 735 : 266 They alone become liberated, who meditate on the Name of the Lord; they obtain the supreme status. ||1|| Raag Soohee − Part 008 34

735 : 267 O my Lord, the Lord's humble servants become healthy. 735 : 268 Those who meditate on my Lord, Har, Har, through the Word of the Guru's Teachings, are rid of the disease of ego. ||1||Pause|| 735 : 269 Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva suffer from the disease of the three gunas − the three qualities; they do their deeds in egotism. 735 : 270 The poor fools do not remember the One who created them; this understanding of the Lord is only obtained by those who become Gurmukh. ||2|| 735 : 271 The entire world is afflicted by the disease of egotism. They suffer the terrible pains of birth and death. −− Raag Soohee − Part 008 −− Raag Soohee − Part 008 35

Raag Soohee − Part 009 736 : 272 By Guru's Grace, a few rare ones are saved; I am a sacrifice to those humble beings. ||3|| 736 : 273 The One who created the Universe, that Lord alone knows. His beauty is incomparable. 736 : 274 O Nanak, the Lord Himself gazes upon it, and is pleased. The Gurmukh contemplates God. ||4||3||14|| 736 : 275 Soohee, Fourth Mehl: 736 : 276 All that happens, and all that will happen, is by His Will. If we could do something by ourselves, we would. 736 : 277 By ourselves, we cannot do anything at all.
